Class AudioManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.ui.AudioManager
public class AudioManager extends Object
Manages all audio playback within the application, including background music and sound effects. Implements a singleton pattern to ensure a single point of control for audio resources. This manager allows for playing, stopping, and controlling the volume of different audio tracks, as well as enabling/disabling music and sound effects.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static AudioManager getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of AudioManager, creating it if it doesn't already exist with a DefaultMediaPlayerFactory.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of AudioManager.

    • getInstance

      public static AudioManager getInstance(MediaPlayerFactory factory)
      Returns the singleton instance of AudioManager, creating it if it doesn't already exist with a specified MediaPlayerFactory. This method is primarily for dependency injection (e.g., for testing).
      Parameters:
      factory - The MediaPlayerFactory to use for creating media players if the instance is null.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of AudioManager.

    • resetInstance

      public static void resetInstance()
      Resets the singleton instance of AudioManager, stopping any active music and disposing resources. This method is primarily for testing or reinitialization scenarios.

    • playBackgroundMusic

      public void playBackgroundMusic(String musicType)
      Plays background music. Stops any currently playing music before starting the new one. Music playback is skipped if musicEnabled is false. Error messages are printed to System.err if the music file cannot be found or played.
      Parameters:
      musicType - A string indicating which music to play, e.g., "menu" or "game".

    • stopBackgroundMusic

      public void stopBackgroundMusic()
      Stops the currently playing background music and releases its resources.

    • playSoundEffect

      public void playSoundEffect(String effectName)
      Plays a specific sound effect if sound effects are enabled. The media player for the sound effect is disposed after it finishes playing. Error messages are printed to System.err if the sound effect is not found.
      Parameters:
      effectName - The name of the sound effect to play (e.g., "button_click").

    • playButtonClick

      public void playButtonClick()
      Plays the button click sound effect.

    • playDrop

      public void playDrop()
      Plays the piece drop sound effect.

    • playLineClear

      public void playLineClear()
      Plays the line clear sound effect.

    • playRotate

      public void playRotate()
      Plays the rotate sound effect.

    • setMusicVolume

      public void setMusicVolume(double volume)
      Sets the volume for background music. The volume is clamped between 0.0 and 1.0. If background music is currently playing, its volume is updated immediately.
      Parameters:
      volume - The desired volume level (0.0 to 1.0).

    • setSfxVolume

      public void setSfxVolume(double volume)
      Sets the volume for sound effects. The volume is clamped between 0.0 and 1.0.
      Parameters:
      volume - The desired volume level (0.0 to 1.0).

    • getMusicVolume

      public double getMusicVolume()
      Returns the current volume level for background music.
      Returns:
      The current music volume (0.0 to 1.0).

    • getSfxVolume

      public double getSfxVolume()
      Returns the current volume level for sound effects.
      Returns:
      The current SFX volume (0.0 to 1.0).

    • setMusicEnabled

      public void setMusicEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables background music. If disabled, any playing background music will be stopped.
      Parameters:
      enabled - True to enable music, false to disable.

    • setSfxEnabled

      public void setSfxEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables sound effects.
      Parameters:
      enabled - True to enable sound effects, false to disable.

    • isMusicEnabled

      public boolean isMusicEnabled()
      Checks if background music is currently enabled.
      Returns:
      True if music is enabled, false otherwise.

    • isSfxEnabled

      public boolean isSfxEnabled()
      Checks if sound effects are currently enabled.
      Returns:
      True if sound effects are enabled, false otherwise.

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Stops any playing background music and clears all loaded sound effects, releasing resources.

    • setInstanceForTest

      public static void setInstanceForTest(AudioManager testInstance)
      For testing purposes only, allows injecting a mock AudioManager instance. Use with caution as it bypasses the singleton pattern.
      Parameters:
      testInstance - The mock AudioManager instance to set.
